name: surface_pm25_monthly_V5GL03
title: Monthly Surface PM2.5 Estimates (V5.GL.03)
description: Estimates of ground-level fine particulate matter (PM2.5) for 1998-2021 produced by combining Aerosol Optical Depth (AOD) retrievals from the NASA MODIS, MISR, and SeaWIFS instruments with the GEOS-Chem chemical transport model, and subsequently calibrating to global ground-based observations using a Geographically Weighted Regression (GWR).

extract_types_info.max: maximum PM2.5 value per unit of analysis
extract_types_info.mean: average PM2.5 value per unit of analysis
extract_types_info.min: minimum PM2.5 value per unit of analysis

options.variable_description: PM2.5 in micrograms per meter cubed

extras.citation: Aaron van Donkelaar, Melanie S. Hammer, Liam Bindle, Michael Brauer, Jeffery R. Brook, Michael J. Garay, N. Christina Hsu, Olga V. Kalashnikova, Ralph A. Kahn, Colin Lee, Robert C. Levy, Alexei Lyapustin, Andrew M. Sayer and Randall V. Martin (2021). Monthly Global Estimates of Fine Particulate Matter and Their Uncertainty Environmental Science & Technology, 2021, doi:10.1021/acs.est.1c05309
extras.sources_name: Washington University in St. Louis - Atmospheric Composition Analysis Group
